sub_title: Vice President Europe at Air France KLM Martinair Cargo
summary:
•	25 years of experience in the airline business, 21 years in management, 9 years abroad,
•	capable in leading and inspiring teams, defining and executing commercial strategies, driven by enthusiasm and empowerment,
•	people oriented, recognizing talents, aiming to create a positive working environment encouraging high performance while making a fun place to work,
•	passionate in leading processes of innovation and change, with particular ability to bridge between a variety of stakeholders,
•	well-developed organizational, analytical and interpersonal skills, pragmatic, aimed to achieve goals,
•	positive track record in negotiating following an approach of building trust and authenticity leading to win-win situations,
•	proven experience in re-structuring and merging organizations in cross-cultural settings,
•	strong adaptability in international, multi-cultural environments.

publications.name: Flight director guidance throughout the parabolic maneuver
publications.publisher: Systems, Man, and Cybernetics, 1999. IEEE SMC '99 Conference Proceedings. 1999 IEEE International Conference

authors.headline: Vice President Europe at Air France KLM Martinair Cargo

courses.name: Joint Senior Management Programme Air France KLM & HEC Executive Education

profile_positions.description: Leading the sales, customer service and operations teams in the European markets, including our home markets the Benelux and France.
profile_positions.title: Vice President Europe

profile_positions.location: Schiphol, Schiphol-Oost, Schiphol-Skypark, North Holland Province, Netherlands
profile_positions.description:
Transformed AF-KL Cargo’s Customer Service organisation into Distribution & Customer Service (D&CS), making our organisation ready for the digital future: 

	•	Defining the overall (online and offline) service strategy, the organisational blueprint and activities for our field organisation, our commercial processes including our legacy system and interfaces.
	•	Driving the innovation in AF-KL Cargo’s commercial domain. Our direct online channel myCargo, facilitating the full online customer journey, its internal equivalent ourCargo for our customer service staff, and our API to connect to our customers and third party portals directly.
	•	Constantly evolving our channel strategy by prospecting the industry, enriching our digital strategy, engaging with third parties such as platforms software providers, traditional and digital forwarders to collaborate in new ways and enrich our distribution activities in the digital domain, encouraging our field organisation to promote new ways of working in the markets.
	•	Providing training facilities and knowledge base to enable our frontline employees to provide best in class customer service.
	•	Handling the cargo claims.

Currently involved in the transformation of AF-KL Cargo's commercial organisation towards a more sustainable future.
profile_positions.title: Vice President Distribution & Customer Service

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for the Customer Service activities of Air France, KLM and Martinair Cargo, including inside sales and back office. 

With a functional link to all customer service staff world wide and hierarchical to central support departments, this responsibility includes the design, implementation and execution of commercial processes and tools that cover the cargo customer journey.

At present the digitization of the cargo customer journey, innovating with new tools and distribution channels, is playing a central role in this domain.
profile_positions.title: Vice President Customer Service

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for the cockpit crew manpower planning chain, including crew planning, crew assignment and crew tracking in KLM flight operations. Besides the crew planning activities, responsible for crew support, health and absenteeism of the flight crew and rostering for ground staff.

Achievements:
•	Managed HPO reorganization, migrating to a single department covering the crew manpower planning chain from 3 years prior to until to the day of departure, re-establishing engagement of the team members
•	Finalized the implementation of mixed crewing for B777/B787 aircraft
•	Piloted a number of projects: e.g. CrewBid, a system allowing crew control over their roster, and Simplex, a system to optimize simulator planning. Followed-through the implementation of automated rostering (Carmen)
profile_positions.title: Vice President Cockpit Crew Services

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for the Cargo Revenue Management department of Air France, KLM and Martinair Cargo based in Schiphol, the Netherlands. Managing a team of 3 Area Revenue Managers, 3 Strategic Flight Analysts and 22 Flight Analysts. 

Achievements:
•	Implemented Cargobus stage A; the revolutionary Revenue and Inventory Management system AFLS (Accenture Freight Logistics System)
•	Leveraged capacity utilization by using stochastic modeling and big data techniques to forecast booking behavior to steer overbooking process
profile_positions.title: Director Revenue Management Schiphol

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for the cargo activities for Air France, KLM and Martinair Cargo in Hong Kong and Southern China, managing a team of 23 commercial and operations staff in 2 locations and an annual all-in revenue of € 140 million for a production of over 50 thousand tons of (export) cargo. In charge of sales, marketing, customer service and flight operations for freighter activity and cargo activity on passenger flights from Hong Kong, Guangzhou and Xiamen.

Achievements:
•	Managed the integration of the local Air France-KLM Cargo and Martinair Cargo organizations, capitalizing on synergies, reducing staff and cost
•	Reduced freighter footprint in China while maintaining customer loyalty, safeguarding our position by smartly developing interline connections

During my time in Hong Kong, we have gradually reduced full freighter activity between Europe and Asia following our strategic choice to reduce exposure to economic downturn. My challenge lied in maintaining our customers loyalty and support, finding efficiencies in my team in a continuous effort to reduce cost, while capitalizing on the opportunities in the market with smart pricing and capacity utilization. It was a huge opportunity for me to be part of the compelling Hong Kong airfreight marketplace in a challenging time.
profile_positions.title: Director Hong Kong and Southern China

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for the cargo activities for the Air France-KLM group in Sweden, Denmark, Norway and Finland, managing a team of 44 commercial and operations staff in 9 locations, an annual all-in revenue of € 100 million for an annual production of over 50 thousand tons of (export) cargo.

Achievements:
•	Managed the integration of the local Air France-KLM Cargo and Martinair Cargo organization, reducing the number of locations, staff and cost while growing share and turnover and keeping the teams engaged
•	Migrated to a new sub-hub setup in Malmö, aligning processes for the three airlines and reducing cost
profile_positions.title: Director Nordic

profile_positions.description:
Functionally responsible for the cargo customer service processes and activities in the 45 stations in the area, mostly operated by Air France only, not by KLM.

Achievements:
•	Established and executed a road map to build CSO in an area where the (Air France) teams were unfamiliar with the CSO concept, establishing coherent CSO processes worldwide (Model Office concept)
•	Co-piloted the ROCFRET project, establishing a support team in the CDG cargo hub to provide service on operational issues for transit shipments
profile_positions.title: Director Customer Service Area France, DOMTOM, Africa

profile_positions.description:
Manager of a Sales Development & Analysis team of 7 staff, located in Amsterdam and Frankfurt. Deputy to the Director Benelux and to the Director Northern & Western Europe, responsible for sales support activities for the sales teams in the Benelux, in Germany, in UK and Ireland and in the Nordic. 

Achievements:
•	Leveraged the pricing practice by developing and implementing the MFO concept and supporting tools and structuring ad-hoc pricing process
•	Making the first steps in the integration with Air France Cargo by animating various working groups on pricing and revenue management subjects
profile_positions.title: Manager Sales Development & Analysis

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for a range of projects defining and implementing KLM Cargo's revenue management practice

Achievements:
•	Developed and implemented tools to embed the shipment contribution check versus entry condition in the booking process
•	Developed RM intelligence enabling insight in profitability of flows and stations, enabling restructuring of area Europe
profile_positions.title: Project Manager

profile_positions.description:
Revenue Analyst in the Planning and Analysis team of Revenue Management North Atlantic, providing recurrent RM reporting and ad-hoc analysis.

Achievements:
•	Automated and improved existing RM reporting for the Joint Venture sales on North Atlantic routes
•	Ad-hoc analysis on business cases liaising with Network Planning
profile_positions.title: Revenue Analyst North Atlantic

profile_positions.description:
Application developer in the Visual Load Control (VLC) development team, responsible for the design and development of a Windows-based load control application, designed to produce flight summary, load-instructions report (LIR), loadsheet, NOTOC and Loadmessage (COPAM).

Performed requirements management, global and detailed design, project planning and time management for the various releases, and system testing. Worked closely with end-users and with programmers for detailed design. My job also involved programming and database design.

Developed IT skills (UML, component based development, Visual Basic, SQL Server, ...) and analytical skills, as well as profound knowledge of the ground handling process. In order to obtain this knowledge, I have worked side by side with load controllers in Flight Operations (KK) at Schiphol Airport.
profile_positions.title: Application Developer

profile_positions.description:
System Analyst in the Flight Business Systems department of Information Services.
Development and maintenance of the KLM flight planning system and related systems. 

My role as a system analyst consisted of writing project assignments, deriving functional specifications of modification projects and development projects, and project planning for these projects. 

Some of the projects I carried under my responsibility were:
• Route Analyzer; an ESSBASE based management information system for analyzing ATC related delays.
• Flight Advisor; a Windows based application that advises which flights to cancel in case of technical problems with an aircraft that prevent the aircraft from flying.
• Acars; implementation of a new mainframe based Acars “post office” in the flight planning system.
profile_positions.title: System Analyst

profile_positions.description:
Adviesbureau Kojac is a student managed company. At the time, its main activities were supplying courses in computer applications and programming software on request, as well as consulting and supporting companies on automation issues. The company was run by five students and had a pool of about fifteen freelance teachers at its disposal.

My primary roles in the company were technical consultant, financial controller (using Exact 6.0) and recruitment/selection of new teachers and partners. Besides these activities I have also presented application courses in a number of companies, amongst which are Getronics, Koning en Hartmann B.V. and Compaq.
profile_positions.title: Managing Partner

profile_positions.location: Douglas Aircraft Company, Long Beach, California, USA
profile_positions.description:
Worked as an intern in the Certification Performance team of the Aerodynamics and Acoustics department.

The Certification Performance team is responsible for creating and maintaining the flight manuals for the entire MD fleet. Flight manuals contain aircraft data that set operational limits (weight, weather, runway length, slope) that need to be met when using the aircraft. The flight manual is required by regulatory agencies (such as FAA/JAA) for certification of the aircraft, as well as by the airline to operate the aircraft.
My tasks as an intern were related to airworthiness, aircraft performance and documentation. I have assisted in preparing of paper and electronic versions of the MD-90 and MD-11 flight manuals. I was involved in calculating and analyzing takeoff and flight path performance and noise analysis.
profile_positions.title: Intern
